answers.answer: I'm sorry that you're dealing with this. I'm sure it's very scary and frustrating too. But don't worry! The last thing you want to do is stress yourself out. Plentyyyy of women with diabetes and gestational diabetes have babies! Why your OB told you your baby would die is beyond me. I'd honestly probably switch doctors. Anyone's baby could have something happen! Just because you have GD does not mean your baby will die. Yes, it is important to keep your sugar low and have a well balanced diet. And they'll probably induce you a couple weeks early. The biggest problems moms usually have with GD is just having a large baby! Please don't worry too much. Watch your diet, keep an eye on your sugar and you and baby will be just fine.

Yeah, I agree with above^Just keep a strictly healthy diet, drink tons of water, keep in moderation the sugars you take in, like no candy or sweets all that often, maybe down it to a couple times a week. Everything should be fine :)

Thank you both so much! You really have made me feel a lot better. I don't know why she told me that he could die either. I got very emotional and started hyperventilating in her office. I felt so scared and just down right defeated. I am going to try my very best to not worry, but with anxiety it is definitely a challenge. I appreciate all the advice. Means so much!

I had gestational diabetes with my first I failed miserably had a beautiful big healthy baby girl. Got type two diabetes a year later with an a1c of ten which is awful. Got pregnant again on metformin and my daughter is healthy as a horse this pregnancy. If the baby was to be harmed you would know by now. They told me that a birth defects due to diabetes would be detected around 12 weeks.  Don't stress eat healthy and exercise.

She sounds like a real idiot. Keep yourself calm and relaxed and just know that sooo many girls go through what you are going through! And their babies are just fine :) very rare to have a serious problem because of gestational diabetes. As long as you do your part in keeping your diet healthy, and your doctor monitors you and keeps an eye out, you and baby will be A okay :) just take it one week at a time! I know anxiety trust me. It is very hard to get rid of it :| but do your very best. all will be good!

I was diagnosed with GD at about 20 weeks.  Its actually true that the baby could die IF the sugar levels arent kept under control.  Babies have died at 38 weeks because of that.  But, all you have to do is manage ur sugar levels.  So your doctor is not stupid or wrong.

Blood sugars would have to run very high like 300+ a majority of the time for that much harm to be done. Your doctor is not wrong or stupid but extreme. I go to two different specialist for my diabetes and my sugars run a little high most of the time and death has never been mentioned either pregnancy. Death is an extreme side effect. Just manage your sugars try and keep them low. A high reading here and there wont harm anyone.

You'll be fine just start a strict diet. No sugar, sweets, candy, soda, no juice. I have gestational diabetes so there's a lot more sugars than you think. You have yo limit carbs which turns into sugars into your body rice, beans, cereal, oatmeal, yogurt, tortillas, bread, milk, bananas. I'm not saying you can't eat these just very very small amounts until your sugars are under control. Your doctor should have you meet with a dietician for this. You'll be fine but you have to start a very low carb no sugar diet.
Lexwiz how high r ur lvls?   I did great thru most of my pregnancy but now they have been running as high as 154 and im getting worried that its harming my baby or making him too big!

For the record I didn't mean the doctor was an idiot for saying what she did lol. Obviously she has to tell her the worst possible thing that could happen. But I just can't believe that she left it at that and didn't talk more with her about how rare that is and how to manage it. That everything will be okay with these things she can do to help. A doctor needs to be informative, but also helpful and supportive.

Mine are between 100-150 most of the time. My babies are bigger anyway runs in my family. Im on insulin as well which is a factor but as long as you keep them low enough where your baby doesn't produce extra insulin he should be fine. Ive known women that have little 7 lb babies and have high levels.

I am 27wks along and I found out when I was just abt 12wks pregnant, there's nothing to worry abt just make sure you follow your diet, exercise and get plenty of rest, this is my 3rd child and I had it with my last also she came out very healthy and I found out at around 34wks so I was eating any and everything because I didn't know. Just continue to pray!!!! Your going to have a successful pregnancy!
I have it too, don't worry too muck thou. My ob sent me to a diabetic clinic and u told me not to worry too much about it. Just watch u r diet and drink plenty of water.

question: I found out I had gestational diabetes. I am 30 weeks pregnant and my doctor said I failed really bad! She said I failed all four tests. I am scared. She said she thinks I might have diabetes without the pregnancy. Not only does that scare me. She also said that my baby boy could die if I don't keep my sugars at a normal level. I am so frightened to lose my baby. I have lost the baby before this due to progesterone levels being too low. I was only 7 weeks when I lost that baby. But now, I am 30 weeks and so in love with this little life growing inside of me. I guess what I am posting here for, is for some advice and/or help with coping with what my OBGYN told me.Could my son really die and be amended do still born? Please help me understand this!
title: Gestational diabetes.. I'm so scared.
